Row.Text: Multiplayer only. Controls how human players spawn relative to each other. Has no effect in single-player games (always uses Random).
Human players spawn on the same or nearby continents. Ideal for cooperative and team-based play. Maximizes distant lands for shared exploration.
Human players spawn on different continents for competitive play. Always preserves at least one continent as distant lands for the exploration race.
No special placement for humans. All players distributed proportionally by continent size. Maximum unpredictability.
Controls how many continents are generated. Affects gameplay pacing, exploration dynamics, and player density per landmass. At least one continent is always reserved as Distant Lands.
Generates 2-4 large continents on all map sizes. More players share each landmass, emphasizing land-based expansion and early conflict. Fewer Distant Lands to discover.
Generates many smaller continents. Scales with map size: Tiny 5-6, Small 5-7, Standard 5-8, Large 5-9, Huge 5-10. Players spread across landmasses. Emphasizes naval exploration and island-hopping.
Continent count varies by map size: Tiny 2-5, Small 2-6, Standard 3-4, Large 4-7, Huge 5-8. Each game is different. Recommended for maximum replayability.
